items.title: Prepare distribution artifacts
items.description:
US-008: As an author, I can prepare distribution artifacts.

**Given** compiled outputs
**When** `/writer.publish` is invoked
**Then** validated artifacts are written to `/dist`

items.title: Compile to LaTeX
items.description:
US-007: As an author, I can compile to LaTeX.

**Given** valid content
**When** LaTeX target is selected
**Then** a print-ready PDF artifact is produced

items.title: Compile to SpecMD
items.description:
US-006: As an author, I can compile to SpecMD.

**Given** valid manifests
**When** `/writer.compile` is invoked
**Then** SpecMD output is generated

items.title: Revise tone across manuscript
items.description:
US-005: As an author, I can revise tone across a manuscript.

**Given** a full manuscript
**When** tone alignment mode is selected
**Then** stylistic consistency is improved

items.title: Revise content for clarity
items.description:
US-004: As an author, I can revise content for clarity.

**Given** existing Markdown content
**When** `/writer.revise` with clarity mode is invoked
**Then** meaning is preserved while improving readability

items.title: Append or revise a chapter
items.description:
US-003: As an author, I can append or revise a chapter.

**Given** an existing chapter
**When** append or revise mode is selected
**Then** content is updated without deleting unrelated sections

items.title: Create a new chapter
items.description:
US-002: As an author, I can create a new chapter.

**Given** an initialized project
**When** `/writer.chapter` is invoked with a title
**Then** a new Markdown file is created in `/chapters`

items.title: Initialize a new book project
items.description:
US-001: As an author, I can initialize a new book project.

**Given** no existing `/book` directory
**When** `/writer.init` is invoked
**Then** the directory structure and manifest files are created

items.title: Epic: Publish Preparation
items.description:
E-005: Publish Preparation

User validates structure and produces final build outputs for distribution.

items.title: Epic: Compilation Engine
items.description:
E-004: Compilation Engine

User generates publishable artifacts for one or more targets (SpecMD, LaTeX, Markdown bundle).

items.title: Epic: Revision Operations
items.description:
E-003: Revision Operations

User refines content at section, chapter, or manuscript scope. Supports clarity and tone revision modes.

items.title: Epic: Chapter Authoring
items.description:
E-002: Chapter Authoring

User creates or amends a chapter using voice-first prompts. Supports append and revise modes.

items.title: Epic: Project Initialization
items.description:
E-001: Project Initialization

User creates a new writing repository with standard structure including directory structure and manifest files.

items.title: Writer Plugin PRD
items.description: Markdown-native authoring and publishing plugin for Claude Code. Enables long-form writing workflows (books, essays, guides) with voice-first input, incremental drafting, Git-based version control, and compilation to multiple targets (SpecMD, LaTeX, Markdown bundle). Separates authorship from Pro plugin operations. Anti-features: no WYSIWYG, no CMS, no proprietary formats, no direct publishing.

items.title: Strategic ultrathink integration for complex commands
items.description: Add ultrathink triggers to high-value commands where extended thinking provides material benefit: /pro:audit.security (OWASP analysis), /pro:audit.quality (multi-dimensional analysis), /pro:react.to.next (migration planning), /pro:handoff (comprehensive codebase analysis). Uses hybrid approach with explicit trigger + guidance.

items.title: Build in Public - voice/tone calibration
items.description: Add /pro:bip.setup command for voice personalization. Allow users to calibrate the tone of generated content by providing example posts or selecting from preset styles. Could analyze existing social media posts to learn the user's voice. Deferred from v1 to keep initial implementation simple.

items.title: Build in Public - auto-surface shareable content
items.description: Pro Plugin skill that automatically surfaces notable development moments and drafts shareable content for X and LinkedIn. Features: (1) Skill-based auto-invocation during normal work, (2) Inline suggestions with defer option, (3) Configurable confidence threshold, (4) Fingerprint-based deduplication, (5) Pending queue for deferred items, (6) Draft-only output (manual copy-paste to platforms). Storage at .plan/build-in-public/. Turns 'building in public' into a byproduct of real work.

items.title: /pro:spike git worktree example uses hardcoded path
items.description: In pro/commands/spike.md lines 24-35, the git worktree tip creates a worktree using $(basename $PWD)--experiment but the cd and remove commands hardcode 'project--experiment'. Should use $(basename $PWD)--experiment consistently.

items.title: Comprehensive security audit command
items.description: Add /pro:audit.security command for deep security analysis. Features: (1) CVE scanning via multiple tools (npm audit, pip-audit, cargo audit, etc.) with merged results, (2) OWASP Top 10 static analysis covering all categories A01-A10, (3) Secrets scanning in current files AND git history using truffleHog/gitleaks, (4) Framework-specific attack vector analysis with severity weighting, (5) Compliance-style report with scores + detailed findings, (6) Graceful degradation when tools unavailable. Far more comprehensive than /pro:audit's basic security checks.

items.title: Git worktree integration for agent sandboxing
items.description: Explore using git worktrees to create isolated sandboxes for Claude agents. Inspired by DHH's workflow where `ga fix` creates a worktree+branch and `gd` destroys it. Goals: (1) parallel isolation - agents work without touching user's current branch, (2) multi-agent sandboxes - multiple agents working in parallel, (3) safer experimentation - spike work fully isolated from main.
items.resolution: Added tip to /pro:spike command documenting git worktrees for full isolation. No new commands needed - pattern already supported by Claude Code.

items.title: /pro:dev.setup gitignore ignores entire .dev/ directory
items.description: The /pro:dev.setup command is adding .dev/ to gitignore (ignoring entire directory) instead of only ignoring .dev/pid.json and .dev/log/. This causes .dev/servers.json and .dev/README.md to not be tracked by git, which blocks team sharing of configuration. Root cause: Phase 5 instructions are ambiguous and don't explicitly warn against adding .dev/ as catch-all.

items.title: /pro:git.main - Standardize default branch to main
items.description: Add /pro:git.main command that standardizes a repository's default branch name to 'main'. Features: inspection-first workflow, safety gates (uncommitted changes, existing main branch, detached HEAD, permissions), explicit phrase confirmation 'CONFIRM RENAME TO MAIN', pre-check via gh api for permissions, support for local-only repos with adjusted behavior.

items.title: React to Next.js migration command
items.description: Add /pro:react.to.next command that converts client-rendered React applications into Next.js applications using a deterministic, auditable migration pipeline. Key features: in-place migration preserving git history, App Router default with Pages Router fallback, guaranteed route safety (no valid URL may 404), guided prompt-based execution, preflight detection engine, and comprehensive migration documentation.

items.title: Consider splitting /pro:gaps into analyze and fix commands
items.description: The current /pro:gaps command both analyzes gaps AND creates branches to fix them. Consider whether this should be two separate commands for clearer purpose: one for analysis/verification only, and one for addressing identified gaps.

items.title: /pro:readme - No Offline Mode
items.description: If network is unavailable, badge and link validation will fail. Currently warns user and proceeds with syntax-only checks. Could cache validation results or provide explicit offline mode flag.

items.title: /pro:readme - No Badge Preview Images
items.description: When proposing badges, we describe them but don't show actual rendered previews. Currently shows text descriptions. Could use terminal image rendering or generate a preview document.

items.title: /pro:readme - No README Templates for Specific Frameworks
items.description: Dynamic generation works well but some frameworks (Next.js, Rails, etc.) have community-standard README patterns. Currently uses generic structure adapted to project type. Could add optional framework-specific templates.

items.title: /pro:readme - No Automated Section Ordering
items.description: When generating sections, the order is hardcoded rather than learned from the ecosystem. Currently uses fixed section order based on common patterns. Could analyze popular repositories to determine optimal ordering.

items.title: /pro:readme - No Diff Visualization
items.description: Changes are described in text but not shown as an actual diff. Currently summarizes changes in categories (sections, badges, links). Could show side-by-side or unified diff format.

items.title: /pro:readme - No CI/CD Badge Auto-Detection for all providers
items.description: Currently checks for GitHub Actions but not all CI providers. Could detect CircleCI, Travis CI, GitLab CI, etc.

items.title: PRD/spec intake workflow - backlog preservation
items.description: Need a way to parse multi-story specs/PRDs and persist backlog without losing stories that aren't immediately worked on. Current /pro:feature is designed for single features. When given a full PRD with epics and user stories, there's no persistence layer for 'the rest'. Options: make /pro:feature smart enough to detect PRDs and create backlog, or introduce a separate command (e.g., /pro:roadmap). Must avoid command sprawl while not bloating /pro:feature.

items.title: New work-type commands and spec ingestion layer
items.description: Introduce /pro:spike (exploratory work), /pro:chore (maintenance work), /pro:spec.import (ingest and persist specs), and /pro:spec (view imported specs). Codify branch-naming invariant: all work-initiating commands create branches with intent-appropriate prefixes. This addresses backlog item #8 by providing lossless spec ingestion with auto-parsing of epics/stories to backlog.

items.title: MVP cut line workflow with MoSCoW prioritization
items.description: Add MVP awareness to the backlog system using MoSCoW notation (MUST/SHOULD/COULD/WONT). Enhance /pro:spec.import to detect MoSCoW markers. Create /pro:backlog.mvp command to run through all MVP items in a single branch. Update /pro:backlog to show phase badges and select MVP items by default. Infer phase from severity when no explicit markers exist.

items.title: Rename plugin description from Product Planning to Product Owner
items.description: Change plugin.json description field from 'Product Planning' to 'Product Owner' to better reflect the plugin's purpose as a Product Owner toolkit.
